Webonomics 1.0 documentation

6.2. Let Us Start

«  6.1. Login Page   ::   Contents   ::   7. The Main Page  »

6.2. Let Us Start¶

Before starting the specific to the Login Page, we need to add a title to the webpage.

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
     <head>
             <title> Login Page - Myzone.in </title>
     </head>
</html>

6.2.1. The Header¶

  1. We first add the <body> tag and add some color to it using an external CSS, which is embedded inside the HTML document using <link>.
  2. Add a <div> for header and give it a class name header, so that we can style it as per our requirement. Give it also a background color.
  3. We first add the <body> tag and add some color to it using an external CSS, which is embedded inside the HTML document using <link>.
  4. Add a <div> for header and give it a class name header, so that we can style it as per our requirement. Give it also a background color.
  5. Make margin of the body as 0, so that the div is aligned with the body tag.
  6. Mention height and width of the header.
  7. Place MyZone.in in the center.
  8. Then we include the logo in the left

Below is the code :

<!DOCTYPE html>

<!-- We are starting a html document -->
<!-- -->
<html>

<!-- The Head-->
<head>


<!-- Charset -->
<meta charset="UTF-8">

<!-- Title -->
<title> Login Page - Myzone </title>


<!-- StyleSheets-->

Corresponding CSS :

body {
        background-color: #ff3377;
        margin:0;
}
.header {
        width: 100%;
        height: 100px;
        background-color: #afff00;
}

h1 {
        text-align: center;
        margin:0;
        padding: 20px;
}

.logo {
        float: left;
        width: 120px;
        height: 100px;
        margin-left: 10px;
}

.name {
        height:100px;
}

6.2.2. Login Block¶

Here we create the Login block with text boxes, where user can insert the Username and Password.

  1. Create a <div> for the login_block and make it center align.
  2. Insert the Text Box for username and password.

Below is the code snippet:

<!-- End of Head -->
</head>


<!-- Start the Body -->
<body>

<div class="header">
<!-- Make a Div to put the logo. -->
        <div class="logo">
                <img src="images/logo.png">
        </div>


<!-- Make a div to put the name. -->
        <div class="name">

Corresponding CSS :

.login_block {
        font-family: "Della Respira";
        padding: 10px;

font-family - we have already discussed padding - It is the space inside something margin - It is the space outside something

6.2.3. Sign-In Sign-Up Buttons¶

Next we add the Sign-In and Sign-Up buttons, as below :

        <div class="logo">
                <img src="images/logo.png">
        </div>


<!-- Make a div to put the name. -->

CSS:

#sign {
        padding: 10px;
        margin: 20px;
        font-size: 20px;
        font-family: "Della Respira";
        background-color: #b0e0e6;
        border-radius: 26px;
}

border-radius - It is used the curve the edges of a entity, here it was square

6.2.4. The Footer¶

Now we will include the Footer at the end of page.

Code Snippet

                <h1> MyZone.in </h1>
        </div>
</div>

CSS:

#footer {
        position: fixed;
        bottom: 0;
        width:100%;
        height: 50px;
        background-color: #afff00;
        text-align: center;
